summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 4, 2019. It includes a count sheet, an out-count form, an inmate roster, and multiple official count slips, all related to the routine inmate population management and headcount procedures at the facility.

persons.name: Gama-Pineda
persons.context: Listed on the inmate roster with registration number 85918-054, categorized under 'HOSP' and 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG'.

events.title: Daily Inmate Count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine administrative headcounts of inmates were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The documents show counts for various housing units (B-A, C-A, E-N, E-S, G-N, G-S, H-A, I-N, K-N, K-S, R-A, Z-A, Z-B) and an out-count procedure.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 4, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The records show standard prison administrative procedures (count sheets, rosters) being carried out, with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein in the provided text fragments.
One inmate, Gama-Pineda, is specifically named on the roster with a 'HOSP' and 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' assignment code.
The documents include verification steps for inmate counts, indicating standard operational security protocols were in place.
The provided text snippets are administrative forms and do not contain narrative details about events, individuals, or the circumstances of Epstein's death.
